subject: Re: [junit] JUnit not matching to my needs - execute order shows design flaw ?
msgSnippet: ... [snip] ... I m coming a little late to the thread, but... why can t you just put them all in the same test method?  Break them up if you like: public void
messageBody:
--- Curt Sampson <yahoo_sucks@...> wrote:
> if test A fails, we know that
> the output of tests B, C and D are uninteresting.

[snip]

> I would really like a way to be able to express this dependency
> information to the test framework, so that I can get back the
> interesting results with fewer uninteresting results. Can anybody
> think of a good way to do this?


I'm coming a little late to the thread, but... why can't you just put
them all in the same test method? Break them up if you like:

public void testALotOfStuff() {
checkA();
checkB();
checkC();
}

If any of the checkX() methods fails, the others aren't run, but the
test is cleaned up.

-Kevin
